properties.name: Donation Center
properties.description: The center is intended for donation drop-off only, and is open daily from 9 a.m. to 7 p.m., according to a press release by Adventist Community Services Disaster Response.Cash donations will be accepted. Other items requested for donation are:• Diapers: adult and baby• Wipes• Personal hygiene items• New packaged underwear• Non-perishable foods, but no home-cooked food• Animal foods• New bedding: sheets, blankets and pillows• Laundry and cleaning supplies• Large trash cans and trash bags• Work gloves, new shovels, rakes• N-95 masksDonated items will be distributed by the center to High Park fire victims starting June 21.The press release asks that no clothing or bottled water be donated.The center is for donations only. Those wishing to volunteer can find more information at www.HelpColoradoNow.org.Read more: Colorado wildfire: Donation center to aid High Park fire victims now open in Fort Collins - The Denver Post http://www.denverpost.com/breakingnews/ci_20883198/colorado-wildfire-donation-center-aid-high-park-fire#ixzz1yAfO4ZTwRead The Denver Post's Terms of Use of its content: http://www.denverpost.com/termsofuse
